seoFooter.title: Hotels to suit everyone
seoFooter.content: We all know that the hotel can make or break a holiday, which is why, at Trip.com, you can find hotels that tick every box. With a choice of over 5,000,000 hotels in more than 230 countries across the world, whether you're jetting off far or staying closer to home, finding accommodation has never been easier. From hotels to hostels, holiday homes, cottages, B&Bs and both self-catered and catered apartments, there’s accommodation available for everyone at Trip.com. Whether you’re looking for low cost, luxury or something in the middle, you can find everything from honeymoon-worthy 5-star stays to budget backpacker-friendly hostels alike. Just filter, search and get ready to book.

seoFooter.title: Hotels with Best price guaranteed
seoFooter.content: There’s no need to go searching on several sites to find the best price, with Trip.com’s price match, you can be sure you’re getting the best possible deal. If you do end up finding a cheaper option elsewhere, we’ll even refund the difference. Joining the Trip.com loyalty program is also a great way to save money. As well as unlocking exclusive member-only discounts, you can earn Trip Coins every time you book, which can instantly be used to save money on your next trip. Plus, membership is free and lasts a lifetime. If you require any help along the way, our award-winning 24/7 customer service will provide all the support you need.

recommendHotels.brief:
With a stay at Britannia The International Hotel London, Canary Wharf in London (Canary Wharf), you'll be within a 10-minute drive of Tower of London and Tower Bridge. This hotel is 3 mi (4.9 km) from ExCeL Exhibition Centre and 3.8 mi (6.1 km) from London Bridge.
Make use of convenient amenities, which include complimentary wireless Internet access and concierge services.
Satisfy your appetite for dinner at Jennys, a restaurant which specializes in Regional cuisine, or stay in and take advantage of the room service (during limited hours). Quench your thirst with your favorite drink at the bar/lounge. Buffet breakfasts are served on weekdays from 7 AM to 10 AM and on weekends from 7 AM to 10:30 AM for a fee.
Featured amenities include dry cleaning/laundry services, a 24-hour front desk, and luggage storage. Self parking (subject to charges) is available onsite.
Stay in one of 601 guestrooms featuring flat-screen televisions. Wireless Internet access (surcharge) keeps you connected, and digital programming is available for your entertainment. Private bathrooms with shower/tub combinations feature complimentary toiletries and hair dryers. Conveniences include phones, as well as desks and coffee/tea makers.
recommendHotels.fullAddress: International Hotel, 163 Marsh Wall, Tower Hamlets, London, E14 9SJ, United Kingdom

selectedReview.content:
Booked this trip for my finances birthday. 
The hotel is outdated which we were aware of and no issues there but if you’re looking for something modern it’s not the place for you. The lift doors were very sticking and didn’t seem to open properly and had a bad smell to them. 

Checked in ok, went to our room which had the heating on full blast and the temp was showing at 39c. We tried to open the window but it was held closed by just a screw. 

The bed was very comfy to sleep on but we only stayed one night so wasn’t too bad. 

The next morning we were disturbed by housekeeping entering our room at 8am saying hello then quickly exiting and then hoovering the corridors banging the walls and our door. We told reception about this but was greeted by a rude member of staff who pointed to another lady then walked off. The lady behind the desk said she’ll talk to housekeeping again so sounds like this happens a lot.

We then decided to go for breakfast to be told it was £15 each! Apparently when you check in you can buy breakfast at a discounted rate of £12.50 but no one told us or offered this at check in. We decided to go elsewhere for breakfast. 
All in all we had a good trip to London but will not recommend this hotel or ever be returning again. I wish I had spent a bit more and gone to a better hotel.

selectedReview.content:
We had a lovely stay at St Giles, London. 
Well located hotel, near to Tottenham Court Road Station, bus stops, supermarkets, shops, eateries, theatres etc. From Heathrow Airport, we took the Elizabeth line to Tottenham Court Road Station and hotel was just a short walk away. The British museum was also nearby.
Hotel staff were friendly, helpful and efficient. As we arrived rather early, Nikki helped us to secure a room earlier than official check in time, so that we can put our luggages and rest.
The concierge guys were great, giving advice on how best to get to our destination. The Chinese gentleman, sorry, I didn't get his name, even helped me with my Bolt app bookings!
We booked 2 new twin rooms. Although they were small, they were sufficient for 2 pax in each room. All amenities that we needed were available and rooms were cleaned thoroughly when we returned from our sightseeing. There was no air conditioner in the rooms but weather was great, so we had no issues.
The breakfast served was excellent, with a wide variety. 
Good choice for our short stay in London.

Loved, loved the close proximity to transport via tube or bus and almost anything else you could want or need in food and/or entertainment. However, we could not sleep at night as there was constant yelling and cussing of people all night long. We were on the fifth floor and it felt like the people were sharing our room, they  were so loud! The hotel could also use some blackout shades or curtains, that is more a personal preference. Staff were wonderful!

The room was basic but adequate. I don’t think there are renovations being done at the moment (June 2024) but we were on the top floor and in an old style room. I was generally clean but dirty marks on the pillows. The bathroom however, was really smelly  and not pleasant to use. Top floor not for those with vertigo!! 
That said it was a great location and staff were lovely. I expect the renovated rooms will be lovely (and more pricey). Value for money in the room we had was good.

selectedReview.content: Loved it! Highly recommend. Super easy to get into town on DLR, and amazing breakfast. Lovely to watch swimmers go past. Staff really lovely and very helpful. Am booking to go again. Rooms not vast, but not too small and absolutely fine (shared a twin room with a pal).

selectedReviewList.content: Loved it! Highly recommend. Super easy to get into town on DLR, and amazing breakfast. Lovely to watch swimmers go past. Staff really lovely and very helpful. Am booking to go again. Rooms not vast, but not too small and absolutely fine (shared a twin room with a pal).

We changed room on arrival at the hotel when we realised just how small 15sqm was. We were there for four days and we felt the size wasn’t adequate. Our oversight as was the lack of a television but in a room priced at over £300 per night I would expect a television. We spend very little time in the room but consider it a treat to catch up on the news from the bed.  I also would have liked better clothes storage facilities and less single use plastic- a mini fridge would have helped with this with the milk situation. Five coat hangers on a wall was not adequate with open storage general use shelves for four days of clothes for two people.  The lack of any towel rails  and only one hook in the whole bathroom was annoying and inconvenient. Our towels were changed needlessly because they were damp rather than dirty.  Unfortunately the shower had a bad drain smell too.  However, the room was clean and tidy. We did have a kettle with one breakfast tea bag, one peppermint tea bag and a coffee bag each. The bed was comfortable and the shower was spacious.  Our room was at the corner of the second floor and was quiet with a great view of the Victoria docks and convenient for the DLR, the Emirates cable car and the Elizabeth line.  The reception staff were always friendly and helpful.

Very friendly and helpful staff on reception and at the bar, rooms stylish and well thought out  A great location for O2 & excel  Unlucky with some areas of cleanliness in the room so would think twice about staying again

selectedReview.content: The worst hotel stay I have experienced! Arrived after a hectic day at work only to be greeted by the rudest receptionist I have ever encountered. I travel and stay in London on a weekly basis and have never experienced customer service like it. Receptionist was agrresive in attitude and demanded a cash payment of £100 on entering the hotel. I explained I had paid in adance in full via booking.com with no notification at time of booking that a deposit would be required. Rudely demanded of photo ID and notified a charge of £250 would be taken for evidence of drug use. I am a professional business customer and this was so poorly judged by staff. I was told I was emailed on booking that cash deposit of £100 would be demanded on booking 2 weeks prior. Communication was provided on the day at 9.00am via booking.com email and was not seen due to being at work. Was told I should walk to a cash point in the rain with little direction as to where the nearest cash point was. It was pouring with rain, getting dark and I was a lone female customer. Receptionist replied that she was happy to cancel my booking if I preferred . The day of the queen's return to buckingham Palace with no chance of securing an alternative hotel. After returning with the cash I was given a key card with no holder with room number on. I made my way to my room after clarifying room number twice, staff area doors in corridors left open exposing dirty laundry, key card device broken off door, semen stains on wall, public hair on top of bed sheets. Mortified, so much so I didn't get under the sheets for fear of what I would find. Tried to have a wash to find the shower gel had been topped up 3 quarters with water from a previous guest. Worst stay of my life!!! Unsafe and should be closed down!!

Horrible staff and extremely poor service!!!   The lady shout me and said she’s the deputy manager. She was so rude as I was simply asking her a tower for my child 3 times, but she just keep shouting to me later later and then she didn’t providing anything.   After that I just told her about the room’s problems. There were so many flies inside, the shower was smelly, no towers, and it sinking everywhere, but she’s just denied and said that was the standard room. And they said there’s no service room like cleaning. They just clean the room after 1 week.   When I was here I can see, that wasn’t only me. There were so many customers made the complaints as the rooms weren’t same as pictures on the website. 1 lady was crying as the staff refused to cancel for her and said she doesn’t care. If she want to cancel, she will loose her money. Other man got pissed of with the same situation of the room was completely different with what they saw online.   They even forced me to check out at 9am instead of 11:00 as normal even though our room is prepaid but it took forever for check in as they said there was no booking for us. Many times I asked them please double check, but the manager asked us to leave otherwise they will call the police. That was so horrible when I got a young child, and that was late night.   I would advise everyone not to book in advance, better not to stay.

Rooms and hotel have scraped walls that need painting, bits of paper stuck up for room numbers, dirt on the floor, loose taps, half the lights blown, socket covers broken, entire ceiling bubbling with moisture and previous rot, shower stuck on boiling hot and floods the bathroom floor when used due to plug hole full of hairs and blocked. This is the worst hotel I've ever used there must be better for the price. Door is left open in the night and reception is rarely manned. They also take a cash deposit incase you manage to damage the rooms any further than they are. There were many more problems with the room

You'll be centrally located in London with a stay at Leonardo Royal London Tower Bridge, within a 15-minute walk of Tower Bridge and Tower of London. This 4-star hotel is 1.3 mi (2.1 km) from Borough Market and 1.5 mi (2.4 km) from Museum of London.
Relax at the full-service spa, where you can enjoy massages, body treatments, and facials. You're sure to appreciate the recreational amenities, including an indoor pool, a spa tub, and a sauna. Additional features at this hotel include complimentary wireless Internet access, concierge services, and wedding services.
Enjoy Modern European cuisine at Leo's, a restaurant which features a bar/lounge, or stay in and take advantage of the 24-hour room service. Buffet breakfasts are served on weekdays from 6:30 AM to 10:00 AM and on weekends from 7:00 AM to 10:30 AM for a fee.
Featured amenities include express check-in, express check-out, and dry cleaning/laundry services. Planning an event in London? This hotel has facilities measuring 11707 square feet (1088 square meters), including a conference center.
Make yourself at home in one of the 370 guestrooms featuring espresso makers and LED televisions. Cable television is provided for your entertainment. Private bathrooms with separate bathtubs and showers feature deep soaking bathtubs and rainfall showerheads. Conveniences include laptop-compatible safes and desks, and housekeeping is provided on request.

selectedReview.content: Stayed here for one night, second visit. Last time when I arrived they told me I had been upgraded to a bigger room with a complimentary breakfast (that was with ***********), but no such luck this time. Room was a good size with a sofa next to the bed. Got a good night’s sleep and the bed was extremely comfortable. Didn’t bother going to the bar but instead visited a pub over the road and went to a nearby Wetherspoons for breakfast rather than paying £20. The swimming pool was great, not too busy when I used it, although I noticed people were ignoring the no photography/phones rule and one woman was even taking selfies in the water! The location is great, close to the Tower of London and Tower Hill tube. Definitely one of my go-to hotels when in London.

So happy when we arrived. Everywhere was clean and quiet. The staff are lovely and made sure that we knew everything we needed to know. The spa facilities are great. You can use the steam room, sauna, pool and the jacuzzi which I loved so much, also use rhe gym and pay for spa treatments which is reasonable priced. The shower in the room wow was lovely and hot wnd powerful. I spent so long in there i didnt wanna get out lol. This was a well deserved time for us both. We will defo be coming back in the future. 
Easy to find as well. There is also a parking g place round the corner which was not far at all a 1 min walk back to the hotel. Weatherspoons was next door also. 
Thank you all for a wonderful stay. See you all real soon.

Great breakfast well worth the money.  Unfortunately the food in the restaurant was unedible, I have never been to a restaurant with worse food.  Pool, gym, jaccuzi excellent.  Rooms excellent, service from all staff excellent.  If you go there, apart from breakfast which is splendid, eat out!

selectedReview.content:
Overall the hotel is perfect.  The bedroom is new and large enough that it can house our 3 pieces of 28” luggage.  Decoration is decent.  The toilet is large and the basin is large in size.  Amenities are good enough and the bed is soft and get good support so that we got a good sleep.
The location is just opposite to the Westfield Stratford Shopping Center which is large enough to shop everything.  Also the shopping center links to the Startford Station where we can take Tube (Jubilee / Central) or Elizabeth Line to any hotspots in London.  We believe we will stay here next time.

Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Beds are very comfy and the room was spacious enough for the 3 of us. Late check out was a bonus and we could even leave our luggage at reception which was very handy. Would recommend and will definitely go back. This is a very big hotel and I was worried about noise level but we had a peaceful time.

This is my second time booking The Royal National Hotel. Located a stone’s throw from Russell Square. The room turned out to be smaller than previous booking, though I had booked the Twin Plus room which costs more.
Great hotel for families on a budget. Clean and tidy , good choice of breakfast options

selectedReview.content: My son and I stayed here last week for 3 nights. Hotel has very good location and was very clean. But nothing more good I can say about this place.  The room was extremely small. Only because we came with small hand luggage, we can put it under the bed, with bigger luggage it was big problem. There is no place at all to take clothes from the luggage. Even not so easy to pass through the room because all the room space was the bed with few centimeters free space to pass.   We really didn’t want some big room, because we came to be outside most of the time but every morning was challenging to dress up. Coffee machine also was out of service.  There is paid service to store luggage for 12 hours after check out, and I have not any problem to pay for this service, but I expected there is toilet when we came to get our luggage before we leave to airport. And it’s not.

We staid a night. The staff is super kind, especially Nevita, who accommodated our needs perfectly and always greeted us with a smile. (Such a precious person). Will definitely book there again in the future.

selectedReview.content: I'm really happy that I decided to book a stay at this hotel. Its central location in Manchester city is perfect for exploring all the attractions on foot. The room I stayed in was spacious and impeccably clean. The breakfast they served was absolutely delicious. However, the only downside was the lack of wifi in the rooms, which meant I had to go to the common area to get online.

selectedReview.content: Booked a room without a window for a cheap 1 night break was upgraded on arrival to a room with a window , twin room , massive room , comfy bed , and  had tea and coffee facilities,  shower above a bath ,  right in the middle of the city centre , reception was very friendly , and informed me we're the lift was and check out at 10am they do offer a late check of 12pm for £10 or 1pm for £20,  also breakfast if booked on arrival was offered at a reduced price of £9.95 , I booked the room for £34 but the option to include breakfast £42 on trip.com so only really  £3.50 each for a breakfast which thought was a good offer decided to not have breakfast here , vending machine for snacks choclates crisps and drinks by the lift 24 hours , tv in the room , security on site  would not let you in the building till you shown you booking number and I.d and was a bit over the top he was it doesn't mention in booking if staying here guests can not come over after 10pm and must show I.d for each person at reception not seen that before usually just the hotel booked shows I.d so a bit over the top ,

The hotel's location is convenient for accessing the city center, which was a definite plus. However, I was disappointed by the outdated interior of the hotel. The lights is broken. Additionally, the staff's attitude left much to be desired. When I inquired about a broken light, their response was dismissive and lacked hospitality. Saying that’s it’s normal, their main ceiling lights is not functional. Furthermore, when I asked for recommendations on where to purchase slippers since the hotel didn't provide them, the staff's response was unhelpful, simply replying: “just go out to find a nearby shop, any shop that has slippers.”

We stayed at this hotel as going to see the eagles in co op arena , it’s a great location for city centre, close to all tram stations, check in was great we were allowed to check in early , very helpful staff , great breakfast in the morning , we will definitely stay here again when we go to another concert.

selectedReview.content: My husband and I came to the hotel on Friday 7/10/2022 room 1216 I honestly couldn't say anything negative about this hotel . The moment we walked in Georgia and neelam on reception greeted us warmly and explained everything.  Once we settled in we came back to the bar to enjoy the amazing range of cocktails made by Gabriel :) the bar staff were all amazing from the manager phoebe to Pablo and andree they couldn't do more to make you feel welcome . Our room did have a view of the construction but we expected that as we are in the middle of Manchester and it was not a problem at all . The breakfast was beautiful unfortunately I didn't get the gentleman's name who was clearing the tables but he was so nice lastly I would like to give mo from housekeeping a massive shout out our room was spotless and he even gave me a kit kat 😀 what stands out about this hotel is the staff and I mean all the staff shine they all greet you with smiles and I know how hard that can be for a full shift 😀  can't wait to come back thank you

We had room 1004 and the view was fantastic.  EVERY member of staff we encountered were very friendly, helpful and courteous - for me this goes a long way, even if the facilities are not good, which they definitely were here.   The hotel is spotlessly clean, the room has every convenience you need and the breakfast was so vast in choice, not to mention that the coffee was superb!  We had intended to go into town for a meal before our concert, but as it was raining and there was also a football match on that night, we ate at the hotel and was pleasantly surprised at the quality (was expecting the usual fast food burgers or pizza).  Definitely will return next time we go to Manchester.

Arrived at midnight last night, after a 4 hour drive and exceptionally tired. Walked in to the reception desk to be welcomed by a staff member on the phone speaking with a guest that was complaining die to their room not being cleaned. Once the call was finished he checked me in very quickly and not welcoming at all. I was not given any information about breakfast times or any other amenities. Basically paid for the room and got given the room key and directed to the elevator as if I was inconveniencing him. Got into the room looked beautiful, however was surrounded by a construction site outside my window. When heeting ready for bed wanted to wash my face so took the smaller towel in the cupboard to see that it had been used and looked like there was mascara or a black stain from previous guests. Then I saw that they do room service so decided to give them a call as I was thirsty and no drinks were offered in the room. I called them 6 times without any answer and eventually gave up. Unfortunately will not be returning as the price I paid I expected at least better service from staff and cleanliness.

recommendHotels.hotelName: Hampton by Hilton Manchester Northern Quarter
recommendHotels.brief:
Located in the heart of Manchester's stylish Northern Quarter, the friendly Manchester awaits you at Hampton by Hilton Manchester Northern Quarter, City Centre. 

Hampton by Hilton Manchester is an ideal destination for your next city break or base for exploring after a busy day in the office. Relax in modern bedrooms with all the amenities you need for an enjoyable stay. Stay energised with our range of hot and cold delights from the 24-hour snacks menu. 

Fuel your day at breakfast, with unlimited coffee and the famous waffles. Stay connected with free WiFi in the lobby and all guest rooms, great for checking emails or uploading your latest city-break-snap to social media. 

Remember you can always fit your workout when you stay with us, all guests have complimentary use of cardio machines and free weights. 
Manchester Victoria Station, Manchester Arena and the major shopping district are all only a short walk away. We are steps from all that Manchester offers to make your stay easy and enjoyable. 

Transportation is available at Manchester Piccadilly Railway Station, which is only a short drive away. Wherever your journey takes you, we're happy to help make it better along the way.
recommendHotels.fullAddress: 41 Rochdale Rd, Manchester, United Kingdom

selectedReview.content: I spent 21 days at this Hilton whilst awaiting my apartment to be ready. The incredibly hospitable staff made the stay a 4/5. Mo the general manager is a top class human as well as a collaborative, uplifting manager. The hotel ac was constantly disrupted, likely due to the unprecedented level of climate change weather, this year. The front desk staff were ready and willing to help with anything I needed. They are mostly 20 somethings that by nature enjoy genuinely helping people. Taren ”consummate professional”, Pier ” my fav Italian”, Igor ”the hustler”, Abbie ”comforting smile”, Demi ”sweetest person”, Winnie ”wish I could adopt her”, Faz ”the kindest human ever”, Lianna ”gets it done - even without a business center”, Serena ”kind and quick”, Jordan ”kind smile” and Patrick ”the mix master”, I would ike to publically thank each of these people for: providing fans in a pinch, providing business center services with0ut a business center, helping with a hot coffee (my fault) incident, suggestions for delicious BRITISH FOOD (?!@$!?), ideas on how to expedite my Manc assimilation. The maid staff were happy to provide extra towels and coffee creamers... they respected privacy and would leave supplies outside of our door unsolicited when we hung our do not disturb sign out... the list goes on and on. This is a wonderful Hampton that should be a model for all of the rest. I've been to a lot of them! I am forever grateful to the kind people here. They would have received 5 stars if the ac worked and the breakfast was changed up a bit. But @HiltonHotels needs to give everyone here a raise.

Very pleasantly surprised by an excellent experience staying one night in this hotel. The facilities were all excellent, the staff were all brilliant. Duty manager, Cameron, looked after us perfectly. The hotel was spotlessly clean and the room was functional and practical. Easy walk into the city centre. Great car parking. I will definitely stay again.

We arrived and could not prebook a disabled parking space in the underground car park, but took our chances there would be a free disabled space. On arrival there were two cars taking up the designated spaces without displaying a blue badge. When my wife went to reception the red faced manageress came and moved her car saying there was no other spaces available. So she moved her white car and we parked. The receptionist questioned why we couldn’t park elsewhere when we need the space to get a wheelchair out and open the door fully. Unbelievable!!

With a stay at Ox Hotel Manchester in Manchester, you'll be a 5-minute drive from Salford Quays and 6 minutes from Trafford Centre. This hotel is 3.4 mi (5.4 km) from Old Trafford and 4.7 mi (7.6 km) from Canal Street.

selectedReview.content: I stayed at the Milton last night the 22nd and it was excellent. I had read the reviews and was a  bot concerned by them so approached the entrance with caution. Its clear the building used to be an office block and home to the DHSS. I was directed to the hotel reception where the pleasant surprises began clean airy and a very efficient and welcoming receptionist. Then onto the room which medium sized was warm the bed comfortable and the shower powerful . I ate in the bar and had a well cooked meal and a beer . Next morning breakfast was simply incredible value the selection was large the coffee good and the produce used a step up. All the staff I interacted with were friendly and helpful . Its cheap but its great

Always stay here when visiting the area each month.  Good sized rooms, good bathroom and great breakfast.  You get what you pay for, so its not the Carlton Ritz, but great for a stopover and I always find the price very reasonable.  Its a strange mix of offices on some floor, rooms on the others.  Bit of an unsual set up for a hotel, but it works.  Free car park too.

We came for a horrorconvention at the bowlers exhibition,  we stayed her and it was great, clean  friendly staff, lovely food. Ideal for trafford centre 10 mins away.  Breakfast had a good range of food. Reasonable prices at the bar. Room was basic but clean. All you need really. Will definitely book again.

selectedReview.content: Rooms are clean and tidy. Lovely comfy bed but pillows need replacing as falling apart There was no hairdryer in our room but this was quickly rectified once we asked for one, We had a lovely chilled stay in our room but would not recommend the in house restaurant. I have left a separate review of that..👎 Reception and cleaning staff who we met around the hotel were super friendly. We were on floor 5 and it was so peaceful. If I hadn’t heard a shower (very quiet) next door I would have thought we were the only ones on that floor. Hotel is just a short walk from everywhere so in a good position… Only criticism is the hotel is so hot and I mean hot. You melt at reception when you check in. Also we couldn’t get the air con to work in our room so it was. Constantly 19 degrees

Upon checking out, we mentioned how our room was tired and lacked cleanliness. I wasn’t prepared for the lady at reception to smile and acknowledge that “they know”. There wasn’t an apology.   It seems poor practice to sell rooms when they knowingly have issues.   - Marks on pillowcases.  - Hole in the duvet cover, leaving a corner of the duvet to poke out.  - Dirty water glasses.  - Smears across bedroom mirror.   - Carpet is marked in many places (you wouldn’t want to walk barefoot).  - The toilet seat is only anchored to one side (so it moves constantly).  - Enclosed shower leaks into the bathroom.  - Shaver plug charged toothbrush intermittently.  - Not sure if the extractor worked; as the bathroom mirrors took a long time to clear after showering.  - The second keycard didn’t work.  - Aircon felt non-existent but was still noisy.  - No net or privacy filters on windows, so you either had to draw the blackout curtains completely or be seen by the adjacent hotel’s occupants.   Room flaws:   - The rainfall shower was terrific, but the small cubical made it impossible to move away from the water to apply soap/shampoo.  - The bedside light switches were too far away to reach from the bed.  - Windows looked double sealed, but you could still hear a local bar and their customers at 4 am from the third floor.  -   Breakfast:  - A little chaotic! Staff tried their best, but they seemed to struggle with replacing food.  - Cooked breakfast buffet was boiled to an inch of its life, no flavour in anything.  The pros:   - very good size bathroom, with separate shower and bath. Modern looking.  - a good central location.  - local parking discount (25%)  302 Saturday 25th Sep

I stayed here as an overnight before a flight. I was impressed by how big and comfortable the room was for the price I paid (definitely not budget). The room was generally clean and I couldn’t find fault. The staff were helpful and polite. I would definitely recommend.

selectedReview.content: On arrival we were given a nice double room - plenty of space, clean with a well furnished bathroom.  After about half an hour we realised the heating in the room wasn't working so I called down to reception. Within 5 mins of calling, a lovely young member of staff came up to look at it. After another 5 mins or so he had upgraded us to an executive room on the same floor which was huge! He even offered to help us move our cases etc to the new room. We were also given complimentary vouchers for drinks and coffees.  The breakfast buffet had plenty of choice so all good with us.   Cannot fault the customer care but there were a couple of small things that weren't great - the toilet in the second room didn't flush well at all but after being upgraded we weren't going to make an issue of it so said nothing  Only other thing was the lack of light in the room - we had a side room so no natural light got in. There were a couple of lamps on the desk but far too dull - not great when trying to do hair and make up for a wedding!   All in all we had an enjoyable stay at the Jury's Manchester and would stay again.

Very modern stylish hotel with rooms to match. 10mins walk from picaddiliy square, 15 from train station. 5 mins walk oxford rd station. loads of small supermarkets within a few mins walk aswell as places to eat/drink Rooms are large, comfortable and i requested one away from lifts. slight outside noise (pub) could be heard but not too bad.  strong mattress with choice of pillows, great selection of tv channels.. tea/coffee. iron. Bathroom is fine, no toiletries bar the basis. not even a shower cap.  didnt try the bar downstairs but looked nice  staff could not have been more helpful or friendlier.  will definilty stay again if i get a good deal.

Check in was quick using one of the self service machines. The superior room was spacious and very clean. And I was able to connect my Fire TV stick to the TV to access my streaming services. Didn’t stay for breakfast so can’t comment on that. Would stay here again. It’s very central, but just a warning that there’s no convenience shop within the immediate area.

selectedReview.content: Spent one night here as I was travelling to a match in Old Trafford. The stadium is only 10 minute walk away. I requested a quiet room as I had my young son with me. I must say that they certainly did accommodate me. The room was clean and very small. The bed was very comfortable.  One tip, if you want to charge your phone and use it while lying in bed, bring an extra long phone charger cable, as the only socket in the room is under the TV, which is in the corner of the room Its a maybe, that I will stay again. I got it for a great price. Overall, happy with stay. It is the basic of basic hotels! Heard from other that the tram can be loud, but I never heard it. Gregs shop next door in petrol station was handy.

What an absolute nightmare. The hotel may say they are not at fault. But they are totally to blame. My evening was ruined because of lack of information on their website. I had plans at Manchester academy at 7.30. firstly I couldn't park because the car park was full. It was difficult enough getting to the place because of roadworks. I was then directed to another car park. But again because of road closures I or the staff had no idea how to get to it. Then when I had got checked in and parked I couldn't get a bus from the hotel because the road was closed and buses where not coming past. I ended up driving around Manchester for an hour trying to find somewhere to park. Which cost me an arm and a leg. The noise in the morning from building work was ridiculous. If this information had been put on the website I wouldn't have booked. My night was a disaster

No easy access for guests to rooms - they nearly walked halfway back to Birmingham to get to their room in to another building via lifts, steps and ramps. selectedReview.content: Never been to prison but pretty sure this is worse. Zero space,weird smell,plug sockets that didn’t work & not safe as the fronts came off. Sink was full of water,shower leaked and they have better quality loo roll in junior schools. Speaking of that,nothing better than looking at your partner through frosted glass as they use the toilet,even better cause you can here and smell everything!!! If you forget your alarm clock,don’t stress as the other inmates will either keep you up all night or make sure you’re up by smashing their doors shut. I genuinely stayed in a squat in NY years ago and it was better than this. We booked for 2 nights and left after 1 and paid £165 for the night across the road which was a palace! My fault for being tight but I’ve honestly had more enjoyable trips to the dentist than Easy hotel. Even their planes are better Oh yeah and the bed was awful too and slanted!! I’d sleep on the street before I stayed there again!

selectedReview.content: we came back from an event approx midnight. asked for 2 glasses of red wine at the bar. staff member offered us a number of bottles . we picked one, she opened it. then the duty manager turned up and said that this wine wasn’t available by the glass only by the bottle. ( which was £55) we explained that we were offered this option by the bar staff but he still said no. bar staff then had to put the cork back in the bottle. we asked how they could do that when it could only bought by the bottle and no customer would buy a bottle of wine that had already been opened. no change. out of courtesy to the bar staff we agreed to pick another red wine. turns out they only had one glass left of that one and no spares . therefore we ended up with our 3rd choice option. this all took 45mns from order to serve. some of the worst hotel service we have ever had.

selectedReview.content: The location of this hotel is perfect. A few minutes walk up James Street towards all the shopping, cinema, restaurants in Liverpool One as well as the rest of the city and if you go the opposite way you are at Albert Dock. There is a Weatherspoons directly across the road serving food and drinks too   The whole building is clean and modern.   Unfortunately, we found the beds to be uncomfortable. So hard to get a good night's sleep.  Some floors seem to be used for emergency housing, a lot of people just hanging around and bringing old bikes up the lifts. Whole building heating is set really high.  Drinks from the fridge are expensive €5 for a water and pepsi. No parking (you have to park at Liverpool One) so if it's raining you will be soaked by the time you walk back to the hotel. It's not cheap either £16 pound from 10pm -10am (off peak) and that included a €30 off voucher from the hotel.   I would still use this hotel but probably more as a solo traveller.

Great location and staff are so friendly , helpful and welcoming after reading reviews I was unsure what to expect but my room was lovely and spotless.  I have seen many comments about it being used as council accommodation and it clearly is . However I think it's amazing that the hotel facilitate this with the local council for people in dire need or hit unfortunate circumstance out there control yet still provide rooms and customers service to a high standard to there guests staying buisness/leisure.  Well done Heeton Concept for doing your part for your city and humanity we need more of this in todays world. Thanks for a lovely stay  ❤️✌🏼

This hotel was booked as a birthday treat for hubby by our children. Although I had read some bad reviews I thought I would just wait and make up my own mind. The staff are really friendly, the rooms are nice and clean and it’s in a great location. Not 5 star but it’s great for a short stay. I think it’s admirable that they are housing people who have fallen on hard times, my only complaint is that I don’t think they should be put on the same floors as paying guests.

recommendHotels.brief: The Ropewalks Hotel, Best Western Premier Collection is surrounded by a lively and eclectic mix of independent restaurants and shops and exciting bars, cocktail joints, music and arts venues. Just beyond (in a comfortable walking distance through the Liverpool One shopping area - with flagship department stores and smaller favorites) is the river Mersey where you’ll explore the city’s cultural and heritage sites, the famous ferry, the Albert Dock, MS Arena and the iconic Three Graces.The Ropewalks area is a fascinating central location, given its name from the many roperie streets – long and straight for the craft of rope making. A testament to the 19th century Liverpool heyday of maritime greatness. With 102 listed buildings Ropewalks is a handsome mixture of merchant houses, counting houses, and warehouses where breweries, timber yards, cooperages, potteries, foundries, sugar refining, and roperies flourished.
recommendHotels.fullAddress: 42 Seel Street, Liverpool, United Kingdom

recommendHotels.hotelName: Hampton by Hilton Liverpool City Centre
recommendHotels.brief:
Hampton by Hilton Liverpool City Centre is a hotel which successfully combines contemporary style with warm, welcoming service. From the way we welcome you at our contemporary Reception to how you enjoy your stay in the air-conditioned guestroom we want to take care of you!  Why not talk to a member of our friendly team to get the insider’s scoop on all the best places to visit in this fabulous city?

Located at the new Kings Dock Mill development in the Baltic Triangle, Hampton by Hilton Liverpool City Centre is in a prime location for business and leisure visitors alike.
When you stay at Hampton by Hilton Liverpool City Centre you’ll be within a few minutes’ walk of world-famous tourist attractions including the Tate Liverpool art gallery and evocative Beatles Story at Albert Dock. Liverpool Lime Street Station, Liverpool Empire theatre, and Liverpool One mall are only one mile away and we’re close to prime business locations, offering convenience for our corporate guests.

A World Heritage Site with a fascinating history, Liverpool is also famed for its rich musical heritage which is one of the main draws for visitors. The city’s ongoing love for its favourite sons, The Beatles, is plain to see and fans from across the globe are spoiled for choice with sights and attractions celebrating the achievements of John, Paul, George, and Ringo. The Cavern Club is within a mile, and rich in Beatles history. Music fans will also be delighted to hear that we’re just a short walk from M&S Bank Arena. 

Liverpool is of course, also famed for its sport. Football is a passion for city’s residents with the two teams, Liverpool Football Club and Everton, having a long-running, good-natured rivalry. Their home stadiums, Goodison Park and Anfield Stadium, are both within four miles. The city also plays host to the world’s most watched sporting event, the Grand National horse race, held at Haydock Park, located just 19.1 miles from our hotel.

Hampton by Hilton Liverpool City Centre is a purpose-built hotel which has a...
recommendHotels.fullAddress: Kings Dock Mill, 7 Hurst St, Liverpool, United Kingdom

Luckily we could get a coffee from the bar.   Some feedback - it would be good if the hotel could invest in a proper Italian barista coffee machine as some of the guests do not like Nescafé type coffee!   A proper coffee with coffee beans and made at the time  is much appreciated !

It's just a short detour though. Everything you'd expect from the chain - clean, nice breakfast, lovely staff. The door to the wardrobe doubles as the door to the bathroom - I was on my own and it took a little while to work it out! it's a 10 minute walk to the City Centre and maybe 20 minutes to Lime St Station (up a big hill - get a taxi for under £5)

Had a lovely stay at Hampton by Hilton in Liverpool city centre. Staff were helpful and polite. Offered us courtesy drinks as it was our anniversary. Room was comfortable and clean with everything you need. Breakfast was good and plenty to choose from. Would definitely recommend.

recommendHotels.brief: The Holiday Inn Express Liverpool Central is located less than a mile from Liverpool Lime Street station and 8 miles from Liverpool John Lennon Airport. With close connections to the M62 Motorway and M53 Motorway.The hotel is located within the vibrant and historic Ropewalks district of the city, within walking distance of many of Liverpool’s city centre attractions, including The Royal Albert Dock, Shopping at Liverpool ONE, The Beatles Story and Liverpool Cathedral. It is conveniently located less than half a mile from the M&S Bank Arena, the home of Eurovision 2023. The hotel is proud to welcome visitors travelling to the world-renowned Liverpool football club, located at Anfield and Everton football club, located at Goodison Park; both of which are just a short walk from the hotel.Business guests will find the hotel the perfect place to work from, with free Wi-Fi and air conditioning throughout and ergonomic desks, laptop safes and ensuite bathrooms with power showers in every room.  The hotel has a meeting room on the top floor with views over to the Royal Albert Dock.  Audio visual equipment and catering options are available upon request.All guests can enjoy an inclusive Express Start Breakfast, with options including bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, pastries, cereals, yoghurts and more. selectedReview.content:
First and foremost it should be stipulated up front you need a CASH deposit (1000 baht).

Very clean and modern hotel room. Overall good value for the price considering it has a microwave and a full fridge/freezer. No utensils, though. 2 bottles of water and coffee packets provided 

The bathroom is a bit small but just right for one person with enough space to manuever from the toilet, shower,and sink. Soap provided

Surprisingly there is no safe in the unit. The bed is a typical Thai hard bed. There is an attempt to make it softer by using a mattress topper but it is still stiff. Shower is decent.

7 Eleven is a 3 minute  walk away.

Very inaccurate that there is an ”airport shuttle”.

What they offer is to drop you off at a Sky Train Station. 
You still need to walk to Departure area.
The sign in the lobby says the airport shuttle is 800BAHT one way which is absolutely ridiculous!

 Although the airport is 3km away, it took 18 minutes and cost 148 baht on GRAB to be dropped off right in the departure lane.

Recommend downloading the GRAB app and don't bother with the hotel shuttle service

I found the front desk staff and security to be hospitable and had no concerns with the service.

selectedReview.content:
Staying at the Radisson Collection was the best decision we made with hotels during our trip. Right on the pedestrian street and walking distance to the bund and restaurants. Hotel had comfortable beds, and we got an amazing room at the top most floor with views of the bund! Sadly we spent all day out that when we got back the lights of the bund were always off when we got back but that’s not the hotels fault. Breakfast was good, had the local delicacies that I enjoyed. Staff were so sweet to bring a cake for my daughter’s birthday and it was the most delicious cake ever so smooth dark chocolate yum! I will be coming back for more! 
Toiletries were good and hotel was very accommodating for anything we needed. I will be back to stay here again when I’m Shanghai!

recommendHotels.brief:
The Swissotel Grand Shanghai (Hong'an Ruishi Dajiudian), conveniently located adjacent to West Nanjing Road and Jing'an Temple, is a deluxe 5 star hotel located in the leading business and commercial district of central Shanghai. It is only a few steps from metro lines 2 and 7.

Other nearby attractions within a five-minute drive include the Shanghai Grand Theater, the Shanghai Museum, Shanghai Art Museum and People's Square.The hotel is a 50-minute drive from the Pudong International Airport and just 20 minutes from Hongqiao Airport. Transportation to and from the Pudong International Airport and Hongqiao Airport may be arranged in a luxurious Audi for RMB 700 RMB 450, respectively. 

The hotel offers 467 rooms and suites with modern and contemporary design. 4 restaurants and bars, a modern and sophisticated health club and spa, comprehensive conference and banquet facilities cater to all events and occasions. Whether for business or pleasure, the Swissotel Grand Shanghai offers contemporary style, with warm, caring service to anticipate your every need when you travel to Asia's most dynamic city.
 
The Swissotel Grand Shanghai won the "China's Leading Business Hotel" award at the prestigious World Travel Awards 2011.

recommendHotels.hotelName: Radisson Blu Hotel Shanghai New World
recommendHotels.brief: The Radisson Blu Hotel Shanghai New World is located on Nanjing Road in the commercial hub and premium shopping area of Shanghai. The hotel is situated opposite the People’s Park and right above the People’s Square subway station with easy access to Metro Lines 1, 2 and 8. <br><br>Tempt your taste buds with flavors from around the world at any of the five dining outlets. See the city like never before from your seat at Epicure on 45, our revolving restaurants stunning Shanghai views. Sample a little of everything from the international buffets at Windows on the Park. In the evening enjoy live music and innovative at Sky Dome Bar. <br><br>With 1018 square meters of meeting space, eleven different rooms and easy metro access, the hotel is an ideal choice for important events.<br><br>Treat yourself to a revitalizing massage in the on-site spa, or swim a few laps in the modern indoor heated pool and Wifi covering the hotel. <br><br>The hotel is adjacent to the famous New World City shopping center, which is directly accessible from the hotel lobby, including a large shopping mall, Madame Tussauds, Naruto World, Cinema, Universe Climbing GYM and Snow1, etc., with unparalleled convenience.

selectedReview.content:
Our stay at the Radisson Blu was so disappointing that we both made notes but have waited to post the review so that some of the frustration could subside. We’ve stayed at the Radisson multiple times as it’s been our hotel of choice for business and pleasure for many (15+) years. This stay was specifically for business.

Upon check-in we were told that our room had no window, even for almost 900 CNY that we paid on Trip. And that payment was only a guarantee. Fine. So, we agreed to pay an additional 100 CNY to have a window.

Then, we were also told that we needed to pay (WeChat) 1500 CNY and that would include the cost of the room rate and the deposit. No sincere explanation or apology by the person at the check-in counter, just a lot of uncomfortable laughing and “pay now, pay now.” We felt like we were being cheated even though this was normal policy.

To be fair, the room given had an amazing view. We were very satisfied and had begun to think the worst was behind us.

We ordered room service that included wonton (dumplings) soup, a classic Caesar salad, and a margherita pizza. The wonton soup was great, but the margherita pizza was barely passable, and the classic Caesar salad was an abomination. Hands down, it was the worst Caesar salad we had ever had. Tiny bacon bits, smelly yellow oil, and old lettuce. We ate two bites and quickly placed it outside in the hallway where it sat until 10:00am the next day. Note: you can only order premium (expensive) bottled water and we were told that they couldn’t give us any more “regular” bottled water even if we said we’d pay for it.

At night, the staff at the fitness center acted as if we were disturbing them when we asked basic questions. A total lack of hospitality that should be on display at a 5-star hotel. We really began to dislike our experience at this point because it became quite evident that nobody really cared. To again be fair, however, the male staff who was on duty in the next morning, was sincere and polite. A welcoming contrast from the evening before.

But then at brunch, the three young men who were running the egg and omelet station were horribly loud and rude. Like everything was a big joke to them – and it got to the point where we just walked away even after we had tried to order.

After brunch, probably the biggest disappointment was that we found out that the Business Center was closed. We had scheduled an important meeting at the hotel and needed to print and prepare some items. We were told that we could only print if we emailed the documents to a hotel email. This was not going to happen so we created a little fuss and a polite manager suddenly appeared and handled everything. That was nice. But the damage was done.

After this situation, we made the decision that this would be our last time staying at the Radisson.

Lastly, after more than 24 hours, the guarantee was only refunded after we called and spoke to a customer service representative at Trip who was very helpful.

We are some 2.5 kilometers from Shanghai Railway Station, 15 kilometers from both Hongqiao International Airport and Hongqiao Railway Station, and 33 kilometers from Pudong International Airport, all by straight-line distance. The hotel offers 390 elegantly designed rooms and suites that offer exquisite comfort. Rooms are spacious and bright, with premium bedding and full amenities to help keep you feeling fresh and energized. On floors 3-5, the hotel boasts some 3,300 square meters of meetings and events space across 18 rooms and banquet halls of differing styles and specifications. <br>As an international upscale hotel brand, we champion a new and better way of business travel that recognizes guests blurred and blended needs to achieve personal and professional success by staying productive, inspired and restored.

selectedReview.content: Check-in wasn’t a good experience, but the hotel was okay after that. When I first checked-in, the room key cards I was given didn’t work, which was frustrating as the room was one of the furthest from reception. This meant I had to go all the way back for new keys after a long day. I just wanted to relax! Then the second room I was given didn’t match the photos on Trip.com, in particular it didn’t have a real window, looking over the dining area rather than outside. But when finally settled into the third room, the stay was okay. It was supposedly an upgrade, but it only looked like the room I had booked. The location is the big plus: right on Nanjing Road Pedestrian Street which leads to the Bund, both iconic locations that are great to visit. I didn’t have the breakfast as there were no spare seats, so I went to a nearby McDonald’s instead. The hotel needs to enlarge its dining area.

selectedReview.content:
The hostel exceeded my expectations. Could not relate to the bad reviews about permanent residents dirtying up the place. I didn't encounter any of them. But I did stay in winter, so maybe there were less people. 
The common area is huge and comfortable. There's a water dispenser in the common area, and also a large collection of beer and drinks. 
The room can be a little small, but it's sufficient. I've stayed in worse places.
The locations is also perfect. Just a stone's throw away from Nanjing Road, and 5 min walk from People's Square station. I see no reason why I would not stay here again.

selectedReview.content: I stayed for 4 nights. Overall it was a pleasant stay. I have two suggestions: 1) my room was significantly smaller than the previous stay and I was a bit disappointed. Maybe it was clear in the description when I booked, but I would have happily upgraded for a nicer and wider room. 2) on my floor, 14th floor, there was a strong smoke smell and even some cigarettes on the floor near the elevator. I would personally choose another hotel if smoke is allowed in the hotel and definitely if there is smoking allowed on my floor. Please consider the above as I would not stay again if smoking is allowed. I appreciate the good service at the checkin and checkout and the concierge for luggage storage. I also enjoyed the convenience provided by the vending machine on ground floor.

Enjoy a meal at Coffee House or snacks in the coffee shop/cafe. The hotel also offers 24-hour room service. Wrap up your day with a drink at the poolside bar. Local cuisine breakfasts are available daily from 7:00 AM to 10:00 AM for a fee.

Conveniences include phones, as well as safes and desks.

selectedReview.content:
Convenient Location, but Room Size and Amenities Could Be Better. I recently stayed at the Travelodge Chinatown in Kuala Lumpur. The hotel’s location is excellent~ just a short walk to the Pasar Seni station and close to the well-known tourist spot, Petaling Street. This made it convenient for us to explore nearby eateries and attractions.

However, there were a few downsides. The rooms are quite small, and we noticed some ant activity. If you’re not bothered by these issues, it’s worth considering. Keep in mind that the hotel is basic, suitable mainly for budget travelers looking for a short stay. The breakfast buffet provided by the hotel was simple and not very tasty; I recommend exploring nearby food options instead. I hope this review helps! 😊

selectedReview.content:
The room is smaller than it looks in the photo. The window in the quadruple room I booked is very small and can only be opened a little because all corridors have fire doors. So the room ventilation is very poor. It would be a disaster if you encounter a tenant who is not very hygienic. There is a queue when the bathroom is busy, and the water in some bathrooms is not hot enough. After staying there for two days, I started to get familiar with it. All the staff are relatively friendly, and there is a lot of customer traffic, with many families and student groups checking in. There is a supermarket next to it where you can buy coffee and food. It is also convenient to take public transportation to various attractions.

Facilities: It's pretty good, but some guests don't take good care of it and the bathroom is often dirty. Especially the public bathroom in the lobby on the first floor.
Environment: The sound of walking on the floor and the sound of doors opening and closing is noisy, but it is within the tolerance range.
Facilities: The wifi and terrace are very good, so you can sunbathe and surf the Internet in summer. The indoor lobby guest seating area is large and comfortable.

The beds were nice, the rooms were pretty clean and the hostel was close to Greenwich so I'll give it that. However, first of all, check-in isn't until 4pm which is later than any hostel I've ever stayed at, and there's not even really any place inside to wait until then so you can't go inside until after that time (unless you want to pay extra to go earlier).  Second, you have to pay 10 extra pounds, in cash, for a key and at least one of the staff members was pretty rude. I accidentally forgot my key to my room one day and then randomly a staff member shows up and yelled at me for waiting in the hallway for someone to come because no one at reception answered the door when I knocked to ask about a spare key.  Third of all, the area is kind of sketchy. Even though you can find homeless people scattered around the London metro area I was probably approached the most by homeless people either just outside of this hostel or on one of the nearby streets.  You also can't get refunded once you book and, for some reason, hostelworld said my recent trip there was cancelled (which is why I couldn't put this review on hostelworld).  Therefore, unless you're with a group of people and don't mind the most awful place to stay and/or you'd like to be within a 30-minute walk to Greenwich, I would highly highly highly NOT recommend this place (especially as a solo traveller)!

We couldn’t open the windows and too stinky. I asked the shouting guy to open it. He just said “If you don’t go outside, I open.” I talked with him to know his background and he said that he is from Italy and Romania (this information is to specialize him)  Many people write about this hotel, and the worst review are truth and I asked the travel company to delete the information because this hotel’s introduction is the fraud and fake.   At the last, I attache the picture when I open the window. There was the fixed board written “close”.This is the truth.

pairs.title: How do I book a hotel on Trip.com?
pairs.answer: To book a hotel on Trip.com, simply enter your destination, travel dates, and the number of guests on the page. Then, browse through the available hotels and select the one you want to book. Follow the prompts to enter your payment information and complete the booking.

pairs.title: How do I get hotel deals on Trip.com?
pairs.answer: There are several ways to find affordable hotels on Trip.com. You can narrow down your search results by filtering hotels according to your preferred price range, or you can sort the results by price to view the cheapest options first.

pairs.title: Where can I find hotel deals on Trip.com?
pairs.answer: Trip.com offers a wide variety of hotel deals and promotions that are available throughout the year. You can easily find these special offers on our <a href="https://uk.trip.com/sale/deals/">deals page</a>. What's more, if you are a member of our loyalty program, you can sign in to your account and discover exclusive discounted rates at hotel list pages.

pairs.title: How can I get lower prices for hotels?
pairs.answer: Sometimes booking hotels midweek is cheaper, but it also depends on the season.

pairs.title: How many hotels are listed on Trip.com?
pairs.answer: You can find over 5 million hotels in more than 230 countries or regions on Trip.com. Haven't decided which hotel to book? Browse our site to get ideas!

pairs.title: Can I cancel or change my hotel bookings on Trip.com?
pairs.answer: It depends on the hotel policy and date of cancellation. Please check the policy section of the related hotel pages. To cancel or change your bookings, sign in to your Trip.com account, go to "My Bookings", and follow the instructions.

pairs.title: How do I contact Trip.com customer support?
pairs.answer: You can contact Trip.com's 24/7 customer support by visiting the Help Center on Trip.com and submitting a request. You can also contact us by phone or service chat, depending on your location.

seoContentSharkInfo.title: Hotels on Trip.com
seoContentSharkInfo.content1: We all know that the hotel can make or break a holiday, which is why, at Trip.com, you can find hotels that tick every box. With a choice of over 5,000,000 hotels in more than 230 countries and regions across the world, whether you're jetting off far or staying closer to home, finding accommodation has never been easier. From hotels to hostels, holiday homes, cottages, B&Bs and both self-catered and catered apartments, there's accommodation available for everyone at Trip.com. Whether you're looking for low-cost, luxury or something in the middle, you can find everything from honeymoon-worthy 5-star stays to budget backpacker-friendly hostels alike. Just filter, search, and get ready to book.
seoContentSharkInfo.content2: There's no need to go searching on several sites to find the best price, with Trip.com's price match, you can be sure you're getting the best possible deal. If you do end up finding a cheaper option elsewhere, we'll even refund the difference. Joining the Trip.com loyalty program is also a great way to save money. In addition to unlocking exclusive member-only discounts, you can earn Trip Coins every time you book, which can instantly be used to save money on your next trip. Plus, membership is free and lasts a lifetime. If you need any help along the way, our award-winning 24/7 customer support will provide all the assistance you need.
